page.title: 05Farming (General)
page.content: The farming in this area is unusual in that the actual farms and buildings are contained in the village and each farm has land spread far and wide. No farm has a 'ring fence' within which all its land and buildings are contained. Generally the size of the farms does not exceed much more than a hundred acres and most of these farms have at least a few acres of arable land for cash crops. The trend has been for farms to increase in size over the years, and due to mechanisation, fewer and fewer people are employed. At the moment there are twelve farms in the village of Middlezoy.
